solution_line_template: Starting with the bonus, Maurice would receive it {total_tasks} / {tasks_for_bonus} = <<{total_tasks}/{tasks_for_bonus}={bonus_frequency}>>{bonus_frequency} times.
This means the bonus money, would make up to {bonus_frequency} * {bonus_amount} = $<<{bonus_frequency}*{bonus_amount}={total_bonus_money}>>{total_bonus_money}.
Maurice would do {total_tasks} tasks, so for all of them, he would receive {total_tasks} * {money_per_task} = $<<{total_tasks}*{money_per_task}={money_from_tasks}>>{money_from_tasks}.
So in total Maurice would make {money_from_tasks} + {total_bonus_money} = $<<{money_from_tasks}+{total_bonus_money}={total_money}>>{total_money} for finishing 30 tasks.
